storyInfo: Sora arrives at the theater she is to work at next. Leontuzzo finds Texas and informs her about her next assignment.

attributes.content: Welcome to Teatro di Milano, signorine mie.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Wow, this place is breathtaking!
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Siracusans love to kill time here to the accompaniment of music and performance. After all, when reality is monotonous and difficult to change, people naturally need a place to indulge their fantasies.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Or, to equate their bloodstained business dealings with the legendary exploits of the heroes on stage to obtain a sense of moral satisfaction.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Wow... you really don't pull any punches, huh?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Of course not. In this line of work, we must be clear-eyed about our own profession, no?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Your friends over there seem to have been on their guard from the very beginning.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: I don't mean no disrespect, Mr. Director, but the way I heard it, you was callin' that play yer rehearsin'...
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: 'La Morte di Texas.'
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: 'The Death of Texas'? That might be the crappiest 'joke' I've ever heard.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Hm? You seem to be well-acquainted with that name. That's fairly unusual among foreigners.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Siracusans rarely bring it up in the first place, and the mafiosi here are even more secretive about it. But the story of Famiglia Texas... is one that every mafioso must always keep in their hearts.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: It is a cautionary tale.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: A warning...
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Let's talk about the script itself first. There are countless works based on the deeds of Famiglia Texas, but not a single one dares to actually print the name.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Playwrights are more inclined to reimagine or adapt, with the help of allusion or parody. After all, it is against their interests to invite trouble.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: However, times change, and today's audience finds true history far more salient than fairy tales with falsified names. Wouldn't you agree?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: As such, a remarkable individual has brought this script before us.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: It's a play in three acts.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: The first act harkens back to the era when Columbia was first established, with many a Siracusan famiglia yearning for this undeveloped land.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Consequently, the famiglie each dispatched their own teams, one after another, joining the ranks of Columbia's first pioneers.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: 'In an era when chaos and opportunity came hand-in-hand, some were swallowed by the tides of the times, while others found in it their promised land.'
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: The cream of the crop among them was Salvadore Texas, a man who would later establish his very own era.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: (I know he means the surname and not her, but still...)
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: So, Texas is one of Siracusa's families?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: To be precise, they were a famiglia that originated in Siracusa, but took root in Columbia.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Such famiglie are hardly unusual over there.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: From beginning to end, though, old Salvadore saw himself as a Siracusan, through-and-through.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: And the Siracusans in turn rewarded him for his perseverance, always affording him a Siracusan's respect.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: The Siracusans...
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: The second act chronicles some of the most praiseworthy episodes from his storied struggles in Columbia.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Siracusans can be found everywhere in the shadows of Columbia's history, and it is precisely amidst that tide that Salvadore gathered his famiglia.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: In truth, the contents of this act are the best known of the three.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Even across various retellings, they're almost always the same.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Accounts of 'the Siracusan in Columbia' can be found in over a dozen versions in any local bookstore, mostly romance novels borrowing the phantom of his name, so to speak.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Perhaps, there may even be a few words of truth among them.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: If you're interested in that, I can point you to some of the less-outrageous ones.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Ooh, I'd appreciate that!
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Think nothing of it. Now, onto the third act - this is the one that can change most dramatically between versions.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Because... it deals with the fall of the Texas Family?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Outsiders only know one thing for certain about the fall of Famiglia Texas, and that is that—
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Salvadore was murdered by his own son, Giuseppe, who later declared that Famiglia Texas would break away from Siracusa's famiglia system.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: This act angered Signora Sicilia, and incurred her retribution.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: In a single night, the Texas name was wiped from existence.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: The entire Texas family disappeared... in a single night?!
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: At least, that's what every Siracusan believes.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: As far as what exactly happened during the liquidation of Famiglia Texas, nobody except the parties involved have any way of knowing.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Excuse me... How come there are only scripts for the first two acts here?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: That is because the third act is not yet finished.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Each playwright will invariably imagine their own version of how this process unfolded, arriving at completely different developments and outcomes.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: In that regard, our playwright seems to have reached an impasse.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: That said, the contents of the first two acts are already exceptional on their own merits, so I purchased the work without hesitation.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Mr. Bernardo, is it possible that one of the heirs of the Texas Family survived the chaos?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Like, maybe she... managed to leave Columbia and escape to a different city?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: For example... Lungmen?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Lungmen? If I recall, that's where you ladies hail from.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Apparently, Salvadore did not have a particularly amicable relationship with his son.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: But he doted on his granddaughter, even sending her back to Siracusa, where she was fostered by Famiglia Saluzzo for several years.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Nobody has seen or heard from her since the liquidation, though.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: In fact, nobody can conclusively say if she was even involved in this at all. Some say she's been seen in Columbia, or even along the border of Siracusa.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Therefore, different accounts of Famiglia Texas's story tend to have different endings when it comes to her.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: She was said to possess their iconic black hair and orange eyes.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: If—and I'm speaking hypothetically here! If the last descendant of the Texas Family is still alive, and has returned to Siracusan soil once again...
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: What would happen then?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Certainly a thought-provoking hypothetical, one with any number of possible developments. Playwrights tend to build their work around such logic.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Sadly, Signorina Sora, reality does not abide by logic.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Some say that she is the 'guest' of a family by the name of Bellone.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Some say that the Bellones are the most powerful family in the city.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Some say that she...
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Some say that she left everything behind to go there, not even giving herself a chance to say goodbye.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: I, no, we came all the way here to find her.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Your bravery is commendable.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Since you have been so frank with me, bringing secrets even I have never heard, allow me to be frank with you in turn.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Famiglia Bellone and their guests have indeed frequented this theater, graciously offering their patronage to our humble performances.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Really?!
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Call it coincidence, or call it fate. Is that not how all stories unfold?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: If that guest truly comes to pay us a visit, then our troupe will be sure to extend her an enthusiastic welcome.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Rumor has it that she is a woman of few words, whose twin swords speak for her.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Her name is... Cellinia Texas.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Stop shoving that plate of thistles in my face, Lavinia.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: The seasoning here isn't as bad as you make it out to be. Give it a try.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I'm going to have to pass again.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Are you trying to save room in your stomach for a cold dinner with those smug mafiosi friends of yours back home, who reek of cigar butts?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: After all, only the things that happen there have any real 'value.'
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: No... I just seriously can't stand artichokes.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Leon, I've already lost count of the number of violent incidents that have broken out in this city over the past month.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Just this morning, a citizen nearly died at this very restaurant.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: You're a judge. You should know better than anyone else that Siracusa was built on violence.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Should there ever come a day when there aren't any unidentifiable corpses lying in the alleys, then that would be real news.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: The victim was an employee of il Ministero dei Lavori Pubblici. Your ministero.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: ...Who did it?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: It would appear that Leontuzzo, son of Don Bellone deigns to inquire about the life and death of a citizen only when it concerns his career.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Your Honor, Lavinia Falcone, I really do not have the energy to clap back at you right now.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: We can all feel that this city has been on edge recently... waiting for something big to happen.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Something bigger than the Bellones' ultimate victory?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: If we really are allowed to take the reins, I, for one, do not intend to continue tolerating the thugs that prowl in the cover of darkness.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Lavinia, you're familiar with the way I do things.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: I sure hope so.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Over a hundred years ago, when Siracusa first turned from a plot of land into a country, its territory consisted of the twenty-two cities controlled by the Dodici Famiglie.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: And to this day, that number has never changed.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Just like Siracusa's ironclad 'tradition.'
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: But finally, after so many years, our ever-immutable Siracusa is about to give birth to a new nomadic city.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: A new nomadic city means new opportunities, new ambitions, and new hopes. You're exactly right, we are indeed at victory's doorstep.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Economy, traffic, and route planning. We and our friends have already been spreading our influence through every facet of Volsinii's new urban area.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: When that area is formally built into a new city, we will have the right to lead the future of Siracusa. At least, that's what the more optimistic associates of the famiglia believe.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: And do you consider yourself one of those optimists?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I very much hope I am.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: That said, the old fellas over at Grey Hall haven't reached their final decision yet.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: There's no future to look forward to until everyone there has formally let the chips fall.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Are we still looking forward to the same future, Leon?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: ...Of course.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Alright, it's about time for me to head off.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Before the banquet starts, I have to first pick up a certain... 'friend.'
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: This whole city is sopping wet.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Sorry to keep you waiting.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: I was just looking around.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Celli... Signorina Texas, how do you feel about the way your hometown has changed?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: These newfangled streets and alleys? That hardly counts as 'change.'
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: The way I see it, it's exactly the same as the day I left.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: And... this outfit. I don't think it's a very good idea.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Consider it your very first gift from Famiglia Bellone. Hopefully, you'll find that our tailor has not besmirched the former glory of Famiglia Texas. Please, be at ease and accept it.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: So if I'm not at ease, can I refuse?
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Unfortunately, I'm afraid that is not an option.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Guess I'll have to find a way to ease up then.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: So, what's my job here?
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: It's very simple - you'll join me at tonight's banquet, where I'll proudly announce in front of everyone that I, the son of Don Bellone, have enlisted a bodyguard who's inherited the Texas name.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Then, you'll kill all the overzealous, power-hungry idiots there, and we'll call it a day.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: I'd actually be down for that.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Same. If only it were ever that easy.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Alright, Texas. In the two days I've left you in the city, I've been hard at work conditioning my mind.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: I've been trying to tell myself that the Texas name is worth a whole lot more than the trouble you're going to bring.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: That way, I can gradually come to terms with the terrifyingly dangerous situation I've been dealt.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: The Texases are already dead.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Unfortunately, not everyone believes that.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Maybe you're the one misreading how much influence a ruined famiglia can have.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Maybe, but I'm not just talking about Famiglia Texas here. I'm also talking about you.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: You once returned to Siracusa from Columbia, only to leave again.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: The way I heard it, every famiglia involved in the 'liquidation' tried to kill you on your way out, but every last one of them failed.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: They were all made to pay a heavy price, and it was all sparked by a single woman—you.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: I just work for Penguin Logistics. I do deliveries.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: If you've already made your assessment of how much you're worth to Siracusa today, then let me assure you that—
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: I know at least as much as you do.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: First things first, Signorina. You must have some idea of what's going on in Volsinii, right?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: ...A new nomadic city.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Precisely.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: And regardless of whether you acknowledge it or not, this plan is closely tied to your family name.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Or should I say... it was brought on by the fall of Famiglia Texas.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: The collapse of the Texases dealt a mortal blow to the authority of Columbia's famiglie, and they had no choice but to return to Siracusa's embrace.
They brought back Columbian technology as the price for regaining our trust. Finally, Siracusa had acquired the ability to build a new city of its own.
However, the most pressing issue quickly became who would have the rights to own it, and the power struggle within Grey Hall began the moment the plan to build the city was completed five years ago.
Today, that power struggle is finally drawing to a close.
As one of the oldest famiglie, we, the Bellones, have the opportunity to seize victory.
Volsinii's backup core is already being retrofitted to serve as the core of the new city, and new plates are steadily being built.
In a year's time, perhaps even less, it will be completed.
And your mission... is to help Famiglia Bellone turn this opportunity into a decisive victory.
Sounds to me like what you needed was just a good enough hitman.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: But when the hitman's name is Texas, that might just change everything.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Do you still remember the Rossati name?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Rossati...? Yeah, that rings a bell.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: After the Texases were liquidated, the famiglie that had taken root in Columbia lived in constant fear of becoming the next target of Signora Sicilia's wrath.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: That's when Famiglia Rossati took the initiative to approach her themselves. They were the ones who brought back the technology to develop nomadic cities.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: For a brief moment, the Rossatis were poised to succeed the Texases, even managing to squeeze into one of the Twelve Seats of Grey Hall that no Texas had ever touched.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: This seems like one of those boring stories that goes nowhere.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Boring, and brutal. Grey Hall has always been like that - open only to the winners.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: And the boss of Famiglia Rossati stationed in this city, Signor Wallach, will not be content lapping up the scraps we Bellones leave behind.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: And here I was thinking the dour mood around here was because of the rainy season.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: I'll be frank with you: Volsinii has not been peaceful these last few months. A few of our friends have found themselves in various kinds of 'accidents.'
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Along with them, the famiglie who still remain on the sidelines may end up changing their minds, and there's no guarantee that the famiglie that have already chosen their alliances won't betray them later.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: When Signora Sicilia established Grey Hall, she laid down an ironclad rule: 'Do not kill.'
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: In other words, the famiglie have a lot of leeway to do whatever they want, short of killing one another.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Could've fooled me.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: You are still standing in front of me, after all.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: And so, you invited me back.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: You don't need me to do anything in particular; I just have to get up on the stage you've prepared and announce that I've returned.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: And that stage is tonight, correct?
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Signorina Texas, are you aware...
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: ...that the fall of the Texases has been adapted into one opera after another, performed across various major theaters?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: In those stories, you, Cellinia Texas, are always portrayed as an ignorant child, helpless in the face of your family's collapse.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: But right now, I can say for sure that you are anything but.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: I truly want to know... What exactly did you experience during that 'liquidation'?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: You've returned, Your Honor?
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Yes. Is something going on?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Remember how Alessia said she recently met a pretty nice guy?
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: The one who runs the textile shop?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: So you knew after all!
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Yes, we've crossed paths a few times back when I was investigating a case. His famiglia...
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Yes, Famiglia Gelli! Though they're not a particularly major famiglia, they still control all the textile businesses for a few streets down!
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: I heard they even have business dealings with some of the famiglie that make their way in and out of Grey Hall!
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Yes, we know.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Alessia has been talking us up for ages. She said the guy's going to bring some of his siblings along so we can all have a good time together!
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: It's been so busy around here lately, I haven't had a chance to cut loose and unwind!
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Oh, Your Honor, umm...
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: You... aren't going, right?
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Right... I still have some work to do. Tell them I send my regards.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Okay! Will do!
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Oh right, did you get a chance to look through those files?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Which files?
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: The mass disappearance on Via Como. Family of five. Remember?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I've located a potential witness and am trying to convince him to testify.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: But, Judge Angelo declared that case closed as of this afternoon.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: He said... He said that family just moved to another city. Then, he added that we still have too many things to do, and shouldn't waste our time and energy on cases like this.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Unless I am misremembering, I am the judge presiding over this case.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: The court made the decision internally yesterday. You weren't present for the meeting.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Is that so...?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I get it.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Right, this case is certainly not worth the time and energy. It's only five people after all.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: The husband drives a taxi around the city. The wife picks tomatoes on a farm. They have three children, the oldest only thirteen years of age, the youngest still breastfeeding.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: The neighbors were reluctant to say anything, and no matter who I asked, they all said that life must move on.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: There was no screaming in the night, no crying by the lake, and no traces of blood left on their squeaky-clean floorboards.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Alright then. Life must move on, and they had it coming for crossing a famiglia. Or maybe their luck was so rotten they didn't even notice they were being targeted.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: After all, the famiglie always say they would never attack ordinary civilians.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: And as for us judges, there are always more important things to attend to, right?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Your Honor, I've always had the greatest respect for you.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: To be honest, I have no idea what an ideal judge is supposed to look like.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Even though the Signora modeled our courts after Laterano's, and codified our laws after Columbia's...
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: None of us have ever seen a real one of Sankta's wandering judges, and Columbia's Code of Law is but an excerpt from a book.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: What I would rather believe is that an ideal judge should be someone as determined to uphold justice as you are.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: But not everyone has your talents, or your connections with Famiglia Bellone. You don't have to constantly fear for your life.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: No, I just—
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: You can casually grab a light meal with the son of the Don.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: And earlier this morning, Judge Angelo received a letter sealed in a black envelope.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: ...Which famiglia is behind this case?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Does it make a difference, as far as we're concerned?
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Do you still remember last month how Judge Starocci was dragged by his 'friends' to 'chat' in a car for an entire afternoon? He hasn't been able to lift his right hand since.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Then there's Judge Borriello... That chubby, always-jovial old lady. How long has it been since she came to work?
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: You're right, in theory we're supposed to represent that woman's will. But what is that even supposed to be? At least, I can't figure it out.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Courage and persistence are great things to have, of course, but Judge Lavinia, please do not laugh at the wet clothes of us folks who stand beneath the eaves.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: After all, you have nothing to lose.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Is that so...?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Perhaps the price I pay... is the right to truly be just.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Oh, the phones here don't ring very often. They usually prefer to come settle things privately.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Or should I say, they look to settle things with us privately.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: Hello.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Got it. I'll be there right away.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Your Honor, you know you don't have to take everything so seriously.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Should I bring back some macaroni for supper? We're going to a restaurant with pretty good reviews.
attributes.name: Court Clerk

attributes.content: ...Appreciate it.
attributes.name: Lavinia
